alert.note: Alert for Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 23 at 1:41PM MST until December 25 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Widespread total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, with favored areas in the central Wasatch and western Uintas up to 3 feet. Winds gusting to 50 mph, with stronger gusts along exposed ridgelines. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Wasatch Mountains I- 80 North, Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs and Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...Until AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates will average around 1 inch per hour from this evening through Friday morning, with peak rates in excess of 2 inches per hour.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
